definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Our brains are roughly 25 percent larger than those of the late Homo erectus.
sentences.chinese: 我们的大脑体积比晚期直立人大约大25%。

sentences.english: Homo erectus was also physically similar to modern humans with large brains and bodies.
sentences.chinese: 直立人具有大的脑髓，身体特征也与现代人相似。

sentences.english: Does this mean we'll have to reclassify homo erectus?
sentences.chinese: 这是否意味着我们得重新分类直立人？

sentences.english: Neither was the form of the third skull entirely erectus-like.
sentences.chinese: 形态上，第三个头骨也不完全像直立人。

sentences.english: The Peking Man Site represents the most comprehensively and systematically studied site of Homo erectus.
sentences.chinese: 北京人遗址代表着对直立人的全面系统研究。

definition: ancient hominid species such as Homo erectus, Neanderthal man etc
Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)
Peking ape-man/Homo erectus pekinensis (c. 600,000 BC), discovered in Zhoukoudian 周口店[Zhou1 kou3 dian4] in 1921
Holocene (geological period covering approx 12000 years since the last ice age)
